title: Scotland Picturesque and Traditional. A pilgrimage with staff and knapsack
author: Todd, George Eyre.
snippet: Still further out, overhanging the Avoody chasm of the Esk, there isthe romantic mansion of HaAvthornden, keeping its memories of theseventeenth century-—of the poet Drummond and his visitor BenJonson; with, close by, the mediæval donjon of the St. Clairs, and theenchanted chapel of Roslyn.

title: Scotland Picturesque and Traditional. A pilgrimage with staff and knapsack
author: Todd, George Eyre.
snippet: At the ancient castle of Dalkeith the same change has taken place;the stately pile Avhich looks down upon the Esk to-day is not thefortress Avhich stood the storm and fire of the Avarlike centuries.
